intro: Seriphidium elongatum, commonly known as the slender hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its elongated, narrow leaves and yellow ray flowers make it easily identifiable. Seriphidium elongatum plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small fauna.
